desc.p: This field determines whether local currency equivalent needs to be computed or not.
For these amount types , accounting can not be enabled in IAS.PRODUCT.GROUP
Valid values are YES , NO.
Optional
This is used to specify the required rate type definitions for this amount type to be calculated.
This has to ba a valid IAS.RATE.TYPE.

This is the name of the routine / API which is used to calculate and return the initial value of the amount type This API can modify only the value of the TYPE.LAST.BALANCE field. The API name can also be specified per application in IAS.APPLICATION.PARAM - but if not specified , then this is the default.
Should be a valid Subroutine - i.e. should have a PGM.FILE entry of type S.
40 digit Alphanumeric Input.

This is the name of the routine / API which is used to calculate and return the latest value of the amount type This API can modify only the value of the TYPE.LAST.BALANCE field. The API name can also be specified per application in IAS.APPLICATION.PARAM - but if not specified , then this is the default.
Should be a valid Subroutine - i.e. should have a PGM.FILE entry of type S.
40 digit Alphanumeric Input.
If the amount type being defined is to be derived using other amount types, then this field along with the CALC.AMT.OP field can be used to specify the calculations that have to be done.
For e.g. if the setup is as follows:
AMOUNT.TYPE....... ASST.NET.INCOME
1. 1 GB DESCRIPTION. ASSET .NET.INCOME
4. 1 CALC.AMT.TYPE.. ASSET.INCOME
5. 1 CALC.AMT.OP.... PLUS
4. 2 CALC.AMT.TYPE.. CREDIT.RISK
5. 2 CALC.AMT.OP.... MINUS
4. 3 CALC.AMT.TYPE.. ASST.EFF.RT.INC
5. 3 CALC.AMT.OP.... MULTIPLY

This would mean that to the already calculated value of the amount type ASST.NET.INCOME (if any - from the calculation routine specified in IAS.APPLICATION.PARAM), ASSET.INCOME will be added and from that value CREDIT.RISK will be subtracted and the resulting value will be multiplied by ASST.EFF.RT.INC - this would be the final value of ASST.NET.INCOME.
A valid AMOUNT.TYPE
The description of the amount type created.
35 digit Alphanumeric Input
